trans-unit.source: Represents the chain policy to be applied when building an X509 certificate chain.
This class cannot be inherited.
Each <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> object can have an X509ChainPolicy property that specifies the policy to be used in the verification process.
Note that only <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects can construct an X509ChainPolicy object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainPolicy"></xref> class.
Gets a collection of object identifiers (OIDs) specifying which application policies or enhanced key usages (EKUs) the certificate supports.
By default, this collection is empty.

You can add additional object identifiers (OIDs) to the collection using the following code: [!code-cs[x509chaintest#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/adddaa46-87de-45bb-a760-_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[x509chaintest#5](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/adddaa46-87de-45bb-a760-_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[x509chaintest#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/adddaa46-87de-45bb-a760-_1.vb)]
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection"></xref> object.
Gets a collection of object identifiers (OIDs) specifying which certificate policies the certificate supports.
By default, this collection is empty.
This property is only supported on Windows XP and later operating systems.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection"></xref> object.
Represents an additional collection of certificates that can be searched by the chaining engine when validating a certificate chain.

Protocols such as Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Secure MIME (S/MIME) allow the inclusion of additional certificates for use in validating a certificate chain; these certificates can prove to be useful in the validation process.
This property allows these certificates to be passed to the chain validation engine.
By default, this collection is empty.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
Resets the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainPolicy"></xref> members to their default values.
Resets all class properties to their default values.
Gets or sets values for X509 revocation flags.
This property uses values from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationFlag> enumeration.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationFlag> is the default value.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationFlag"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationFlag"></xref> value supplied is not a valid flag.
Gets or sets values for X509 certificate revocation mode.
This property uses values from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode> enumeration.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode> is the default value.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode"></xref> value supplied is not a valid flag.
Gets the time span that elapsed during online revocation verification or downloading the certificate revocation list (CRL).
When using online revocation checking, this property can be used to set the URL retrieval timeout.
A <xref:System.TimeSpan> object.
Gets verification flags for the certificate.
This property returns values from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags> enumeration.
A value from the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags"></xref> enumeration.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags"></xref> value supplied is not a valid flag.
<xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags"></xref> is the default value.
The time that the certificate was verified expressed in local time.
This property returns a value indicating the time the certificate was validated, expressed in local time.
This is important when validating signed messages, since the signature must have been valid at the time of signing, not at the time of validation.
A <xref:System.DateTime> object.
